TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Settings/Secure extends Android.Provider.Settings/NameValueTable

Docs.summary: Secure system settings, containing system preferences that applications can read but are not allowed to write.

remarks.para: Secure system settings, containing system preferences that applications can read but are not allowed to write. These are for preferences that the user must explicitly modify through the system UI or specialized APIs for those values, not modified directly by applications.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.
If accessibility is enabled.

remarks.para: If accessibility is enabled.

Docs.summary: Whether to speak passwords while in accessibility mode.

remarks.para: Whether to speak passwords while in accessibility mode.

Docs.summary: Origins for which browsers should allow geolocation by default.

remarks.para: Origins for which browsers should allow geolocation by default. The value is a space-separated list of origins.

Docs.summary: Setting to allow mock locations and location provider status to be injected into the LocationManager service for testing purposes during application development.

remarks.para: Setting to allow mock locations and location provider status to be injected into the LocationManager service for testing purposes during application development. These locations and status values override actual location and status information generated by network, gps, or other location providers.

Docs.summary: A 64-bit number (as a hex string) that is randomly generated on the device's first boot and should remain constant for the lifetime of the device.

remarks.para: A 64-bit number (as a hex string) that is randomly generated on the device's first boot and should remain constant for the lifetime of the device. (The value may change if a factory reset is performed on the device.)

Docs.summary: Whether background data usage is allowed.

remarks.para: Whether background data usage is allowed.

Docs.summary: The content:// style URL for this table

remarks.para: The content:// style URL for this table

Docs.summary: Setting to record the input method used by default, holding the ID of the desired method.

remarks.para: Setting to record the input method used by default, holding the ID of the desired method.

Docs.summary: List of the enabled accessibility providers.

remarks.para: List of the enabled accessibility providers.

Docs.summary: List of input methods that are currently enabled.

remarks.para: List of input methods that are currently enabled. This is a string containing the IDs of all enabled input methods, each ID separated by ':'.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float GetFloat (Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name);
.method public static hidebysig float32 GetFloat(class Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The ContentResolver to access.
The name of the setting to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a float.

remarks.para: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a float. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings; this function converts the string to a float for you.
This version does not take a default value. If the setting has not been set, or the string value is not a number, it throws .

Docs.exception: Thrown if a setting by the given name can't be found or the setting value is not a float.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float GetFloat (Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float def);
.method public static hidebysig float32 GetFloat(class Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float32 def) cil managed

Docs.param: The ContentResolver to access.
The name of the setting to retrieve.
Value to return if the setting is not defined.
Docs.summary: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a floating point number.

remarks.para: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a floating point number. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings; this function converts the string to an float for you. The default value will be returned if the setting is not defined or not a valid float.

This version does not take a default value. If the setting has not been set, or the string value is not a number, it throws .

Docs.exception: Thrown if a setting by the given name can't be found or the setting value is not an integer.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool PutFloat (Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float value);
.method public static hidebysig bool PutFloat(class Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, string name, float32 value) cil managed

Docs.param: The ContentResolver to access.
The name of the setting to modify.
The new value for the setting.
Docs.summary: Convenience function for updating a single settings value as a floating point number.

remarks.para: Convenience function for updating a single settings value as a floating point number. This will either create a new entry in the table if the given name does not exist, or modify the value of the existing row with that name. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings, so this function converts the given value to a string before storing it.

Docs.summary: Settings classname to launch when Settings is clicked from All Applications.

remarks.para: Settings classname to launch when Settings is clicked from All Applications. Needed because of user testing between the old and new Settings apps.

Docs.summary: To be added.
This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: If touch exploration is enabled.

remarks.para: If touch exploration is enabled.

remarks.para: Space delimited list of plugin packages that are enabled.

Docs.summary: Setting to always use the default text-to-speech settings regardless of the application settings. 1 = override application settings, 0 = use application settings (if specified).

remarks.para: Setting to always use the default text-to-speech settings regardless of the application settings. 1 = override application settings, 0 = use application settings (if specified).

Docs.summary: The acceptable packet loss percentage (range 0 - 100) before trying another AP on the same network.

remarks.para: The acceptable packet loss percentage (range 0 - 100) before trying another AP on the same network.

Docs.summary: The number of access points required for a network in order for the watchdog to monitor it.

remarks.para: The number of access points required for a network in order for the watchdog to monitor it.

Docs.summary: The delay between background checks.

remarks.para: The delay between background checks.

Docs.summary: Whether the Wi-Fi watchdog is enabled for background checking even after it thinks the user has connected to a good access point.

remarks.para: Whether the Wi-Fi watchdog is enabled for background checking even after it thinks the user has connected to a good access point.

Docs.summary: The timeout for a background ping

remarks.para: The timeout for a background ping

Docs.summary: The number of initial pings to perform that *may* be ignored if they fail.

remarks.para: The number of initial pings to perform that *may* be ignored if they fail. Again, if these fail, they will *not* be used in packet loss calculation. For example, one network always seemed to time out for the first couple pings, so this is set to 3 by default.

Docs.summary: The maximum number of access points (per network) to attempt to test.

remarks.para: The maximum number of access points (per network) to attempt to test. If this number is reached, the watchdog will no longer monitor the initial connection state for the network. This is a safeguard for networks containing multiple APs whose DNS does not respond to pings.

Docs.summary: The number of pings to test if an access point is a good connection.

remarks.para: The number of pings to test if an access point is a good connection.

Docs.summary: The delay between pings.

remarks.para: The delay between pings.

Docs.summary: The timeout per ping.

remarks.para: The timeout per ping.

Docs.summary: A comma-separated list of SSIDs for which the Wi-Fi watchdog should be enabled.

remarks.para: A comma-separated list of SSIDs for which the Wi-Fi watchdog should be enabled.
